Class DemoModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • DemoModel

  • public class DemoModel
extends java.lang.Object
    The DemoModel class holds the information that is used by the GUI. Ask yourself the question, what data would be needed to recreate the state of the GUI? This data is what should be stored in the model.

    The instance variables are from Fig. 14.34.
    This is modified by Paul Szyller to add color functionality to the drawing area in accordance to lab 5 of CS3443.

    Author:
    Tom Bylander, Paul Szyller

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.Color> colors
      An ArrayList containing the color of each point drawn
      The color at any index correspond to the point at the same index
      private int pointCount
      The number of points
      private java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.Point> points
      An ArrayList of all the points drawn
      Changed from an array to an ArrayList to avoid out of bound errors
      private java.awt.Color selectedColor
      The color selected by the user

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DemoModel()
      The constructor has been changed to initialize the new ArrayList objects

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addPoint(java.awt.Point point)
      Add a Point to the points ArrayList and the current selected color to the corresponding index in the color ArrayList.
      java.awt.Color getColor(int i)
      Returns color at index i.
      java.awt.Point getPoint(int i)
      Returns point at index i.
      java.awt.Color getSelectedColor() 
      void setSelectedColor(java.awt.Color color)
      Store the color that the user selected.

      • addPoint

        public void addPoint(java.awt.Point point)
        Add a Point to the points ArrayList and the current selected color to the corresponding index in the color ArrayList.
        Parameters:

      • getPoint

        public java.awt.Point getPoint(int i)
        Returns point at index i. Returns null if no such point exists.
        Changed to use an ArrayList instead of an array of Points.
        Parameters:
        i -
